meanings.sent1: After the attack, the refortification of the castle walls began.
meanings.sent2: The refortification of the city walls was necessary to protect against invaders.
meanings.sent3: The refortification of the old fort brought new life to the historic site.
meanings.sent4: The refortification of the defenses turned the once vulnerable castle into an impenetrable fortress.
meanings.sent5: The refortification of the walls made the town feel safe and secure once more.

meanings.definition: The process of strengthening or reinforcing a defensive structure.
meanings.sent1: The refortification of the bunker involved adding more concrete for protection.
meanings.sent2: Refortification of the walls with steel beams made the building more secure.
meanings.sent3: The refortification of the tower with extra guards made it the safest spot in the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The refortification of the gates with heavy iron bars made them nearly indestructible.
meanings.sent5: The refortification of the defenses made the fortress nearly impervious to attack.

meanings.definition: The act of adding additional defenses to a fortified position.
meanings.sent1: The refortification of the castle included building extra watchtowers.
meanings.sent2: Refortification of the fortress involved adding more soldiers to the garrison.
meanings.sent3: The refortification of the stronghold with new cannons made the enemy think twice.
meanings.sent4: The refortification of the citadel with a moat added an extra layer of protection.
meanings.sent5: The refortification of the defenses with sharpened spikes deterred any potential attackers.
